snippet: If the Supreme Court upends President Obama’s health care law, Republicans in Congress would face a complicated challenge to fashion an alternative.
abstract: House and Senate Republicans are faced with question of what to do should Supreme Court rule as invalid provision in health care reform law that allows subsidies in states where health insurance exchanges are run by federal government; are aware they could face backlash in upcoming elections if millions of Americans can no longer afford insurance and have begun devising plans for stopgap measures that will last until 2016 elections are over.
lead_paragraph: If the Supreme Court upends President Obama’s health care law, Republicans in Congress would face a complicated challenge to fashion an alternative.

headline.main: G.O.P. Is Wary About Winning on Health Law
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Is Wary About Winning on Health Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
